fields.label: Guidelines
fields.options: GUIDELINE TO COLLECTION OF OVERDUE AMOUNTS

fields.label: It has come to
fields.options: It has come to our attention that some of our valued policy holders are not adhering to the credit control debt collection procedures stipulated in Proviso 12 of the External Trade Policy document. We now take the opportunity to bring to your attention to this proviso, which lays out the procedure to follow in the collection of overdue amounts.

fields.label: copy
fields.options: Copy of the Proviso 12 is attached for your perusal, and the same is briefly discussed below.

fields.label: Proviso12A
fields.options: Proviso 12A is straight forward and reminds policy holders that they are expected to conduct their own credit control activity and only refer to BECI after having sent out the demand.

fields.label: Proviso12B
fields.options: Proviso 12B prescribes when to send the final demand to the defaulting buyer.

fields.label: Proviso12C
fields.options: Proviso 12C describes the format that the final demand should take including the wording of the letter, Information to be sent to BECI in the event payment is not received with in 10 days of sending the letter ,or, on, establishment of the debtor's insolvency. The table below summarises the collection activity.

fields.label: TABLE
fields.options:
Period Overdue Days Action to be taken
30 Telephone reminders to the Buyers
60 First Letter of demand sent to the Buyers
90 Final Letter of demand sent to the Buyers
120 i. Threatening cause of loss form is reported to BECI on the prescribed form
ii. The debt is handed over for collection in line with Proviso 12(C)
180 Policy holder lodges a claim with BECI

fields.label: please
fields.options: Please also note that instead of taking the debt to lawyers for collection in line with Proviso 12C(iv) BECI  usually recommends that the debts be handed to the BECI preferred debt collector  -Credit Factors and Discounters  for collection .However, if you already have an established external debt collector, you may handover to them and advise BECI accordingly.

fields.label: Proviso12D
fields.options: Proviso 12D is a reminder to policy holders that failure to comply with the may lead to repudiation of claims and hence the importance of BECI attaches to this proviso and our added effort to ensure that al the policy holders understand and comply with the proviso.

fields.label: Please be
fields.options: Please be remind that once BECI has paid a claim, the debtor is pursued for the 100% recovery of the debt and any amounts recovered and shared with BECI according to the claims sharing ratio.

fields.label: Should
fields.options: Should you need any clarification regarding this this proviso, Please do not hesitate to contact us at 3188015.
